snippet: The shooting last March came after a standoff in which the police said the homeless man had two knives, but in a video recorded by a police officer’s camera, he appeared to be turning away as he was shot.
abstract: Albuquerque prosecutors say they will file murder charges against police officers Keith Sandy and Dominique Perez, who were involved in fatal shooting of mentally ill homeless man James Boyd in March 2014; evidence in case was captured on camera worn by an officer.

byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and JOSEPH KOLB
byline.contributor: Joseph J. Kolb reported from Albuquerque, and Rick Rojas from Phoenix.

lead_paragraph: The shooting last March came after a standoff in which the police said the homeless man had two knives, but in a video recorded by a police officer’s camera, he appeared to be turning away as he was shot.

headline.main: Albuquerque Officers Are Charged With Murder in Death of Homeless Man
headline.print_headline: 2 Albuquerque Officers Face Charges in Death of Homeless Man
